column1: President Bush was recently subjected to a medical procedure during which five small polyps were removed from his colon. The White House, ever the optimist, claimed that "none appeared worrisome," but let’s be real—this is just their way of sugarcoating what could be the beginning of his slow, painful decline. The polyps have been sent off for analysis, and we’re all eagerly awaiting the results to see if there’s any chance this man might finally meet his maker.
